intro: Reynosia septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern reynosia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Rosaceae family, which includes roses and other shrubs. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy white or pink flowers. It produces small, woody fruits that contain a single seed. Reynosia septentrionalis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
